intro: Distictella cremersii, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
